result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
01:43 PM Defendant Colin B Blair in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  
Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases 21CF1594, 21CF1756, and 22CF92 were called for a Jury Status in 21CF1756.

Defense filled Plea Questionnaire and is ready to proceed. 

This matter was dismissed and read into 21CF1594.

Hearing on February 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on February 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
AMENDED WITH THE DEFENDANT'S SIGNATURE - Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:30 AM Defendant Colin B Blair in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

The Court cancels the prelim hearing scheduled on February 07, 2022 at 08:15 AM.  Hearing scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on January 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:41 PM Defendant Colin B Blair in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Attorney Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Andrew Herbers appears as friend of the court. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is represented by the public defender's office in his other cases.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for January 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
